text: When I was a kid I remember buying this based on the images on the BACK of the case. It's my favorite Suikoden, although 3 and 2 can be depending on which day you ask me. Favorite memory from this game: Hearing the Black Dragon roar and thinking "That was totally an elephant." Favorite song: Rising Tide.

author: Eric C.

text: +Eric C. (slamdunkgators) Get on that shit bruh, Suikoden I is an extremely solid game but Suikoden II is absolutely one of the best games of all time, I kid you not.
author: Nergal134

text: Been interested in trying the franchise for a while. Do I need to play them in order? And which one do you guys recommend that I should start with if not?
author: JFK piano

text: +JFK piano I'd recommend playing them in order, with the possibility of skipping IV from what I've heard (I haven't played it myself). Suikoden II is my highlight of the series.
author: SupraDarky

text: +SupraDarky Nah, Suikoden IV is at worst a "meh", not that bad to skip it.
author: Ornstein

text: +JFK piano Definitely start with 1!
author: StevenTravelCaptainRogers

text: +JFK piano Play all of em oldest to newest straight up, even Tierkreis and Tactics. Suikoden is easily one of the best franchises in gaming to this day with II being one of the best games of all time. You'd think I'm exaggerating, right? Fuck that, it's just that good.
author: Nergal134

text: I'd definitely start from the beginning. Suikoden 2 is the best video game sequel ever. You wouldn't understand the references if you skipped 1. Still a good game on it's own, but it becomes legendary if you've played 1.
author: jherek last

text: This has always been one of my very favorite themes in the whole series. It has versions in Suikoden II and V as well. There's just something with the melody and instrumentation that strikes a chord. Lots of nostalgia.
author: SupraDarky

text: +SupraDarky I've never had the chance to really experience this game, and even I can still hear the nostalgia pouring out of this song. This is some powerful stuff we got here.
author: DScribbleF

text: Although, that may be partly because I'm hearing pieces of the song that sound similar to Pokemon, Animal Crossing, and Dragon Quest IX soundtracks.
